availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Dent (Louisville, KY clerk, Provost Guard, chief of police, col. 34th Ky Inf USA)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, clerk, soldier, and police chief. Maryland native. Married to Sarah A. Dent. Father of Laura Dent, Henry Dent, Mary Dent, Sarah Dent, Kingley Dent, and Edward H. Dent. Tax collector in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in 1860. Clerk in Louisville in 1860. Served in the First Battalion Provost Guard of Louisville as lieutenant colonel and organizer from September 23, 1861, to October 3, 1862. Chief of police of the City of Louisville from March 1862 to May 9, 1862. Served in the 34th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a colonel from October 3, 1862, to 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 4, Ward 7, p. 353.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 3, p. 120.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 3, p. 6.
Morton O. Childress, "Louisville Police Department" in The Encyclopedia of Louisville, ed. John E. Kleber (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 1992), 565-67.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 316, 344-46.
